 TREX_SYSLOG_NAME
 syslog identifier

Detailed Description

Thread safe text logging.

This class provide a thread safe mecanism to ensure that one message produced by one thread won't be interrupted by another. It provides an interface similar to C++ output streams. It also allows to redirect all messages posted into syslog with a "trex" name.

The genral idea is that as long that one is cumulating << operators this would represent one entry that cannot be cut. For example in the following code :

 TREX::utils::TextLog log("myflie.log");

 log<<"First text entry "<<'.'<<'.'<<std::endl<<" still first.";
 log<<"Second entry"<<std::endl;

We ensure that the messages "First entry ..\n still first" and "Second entry\n" won't be cut by another message. On the other hand we allow other threads to wrtie a message between these two.

Author:
Frederic Py <fpy@mbari.org>

bool  toSyslog = false

Constructor.

Parameters:
file A symbolic file name
toSyslog Should the stream been duplicated into syslog ?

Create a new instance connected to the file file. In addition, provided that toSyslog is true all messages will be duplicated into syslog.

output stream operator

Parameters:
val A value to display

Starts a new entry to be written in the log staring with val .

Precondition:
this instance is connected to a file.
Returns:
A LogEntry instance that will be used as a temporary buffer to store the full entry before attempting to wrtie it into the log as an atomic message.
